name: The Old Tree
description: The Old Tree is a short free-to-play cinematic puzzle game about a newborn alien baby. Witness this microscopic entity's first moments of life and help it emerge from its underground lair and ascend towards an unknown destination.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Service Pack 3 Processor: Dual-core 2 GHz processor Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia GeForce 310 or equivalent graphics card DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 21 MB available space

reviews.review_text: This review will be incredibly short as there is not much to say about this incredibly short title. So lets get this show on the road.  I'm not really sure what the game is about. You play as this little squid who hatches from an egg and makes his way up on top of a tree.  The game is a point and click game, but you don't move the character. The character moves on his own and you just clear the path so he can continue this journey.  The art style is incredible. It's this games best feature. It's fun to just to look around at the environment.  The game is also incredibly short clocking in at around 15 minutes long, so when you finish it don't expect a second playthrough.  Overall this game is a fun short experience. If you're looking for something while you're bored give this game a shot.  Final Rating: 7/10 - Play It  If you liked this review please consider giving it a thumbs up and if you disliked post in the comments on what you disliked about the review.  For more reviews follow Snort's Review curator page  here  - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

hmmm....I'm not totally sure what this game was really about, but it was a pleasant and short experience. An alien is born (hatched) and makes his/her/its way through a series of rooms and tunnels, sometimes with the help of a bee (or was it a fly?) on it's way to.....who knows. That isnt disclosed, lol.   Anyway, the puzzles werent challenging, but they were clever nonetheless. The graphics were polished and looked nice, and the representation of the apple/octopus hybrid looking alien was kind of cool. Why there were flies/bees (?), a microscopic robot, and a full sized squirrel/chipmunk/something similar, is beyond me. The reason for the elvators, bike pump and so on were equally mysterious. Nonetheless, it was what I would call a quaint experience. The final moment of the game was also quite nice.  All in all, for a ten minute free game, you probably wont find a better looking game with as good a puzzle mechanic.  I liked it well enough even if I have no idea why it exists or what purpose it truly serves, lol.  8/10
Download this? YES!

This masterful piece of art is without a doubt a beatiful symbol of the progression through childhood and ascension to adulthood. The simple yet fascinating puzzles represent real life struggles and challenges that are often difficult in the present but simple in retrospect.  The journey through the phases of life are captured and blended seamlessly through background cues. Recurring themes such as the elevator are likely symbolic of similar real world themes with staying power. Often times the puzzles result in the destruction of environment in order to progress, akin to the difficult choices we often must make- opportunity cost is not free. But this game is.

A very short game. Maybe 15 minutes. But it's free, so who cares? (I only mention this because I've noticed some people REALLY do care.)  It's fun! A good style going, appropriate soundtrack, easy but not completely trivial puzzles... A solid way to pass a bit of time.

It is short. It is not too challanging. It is very pretty. And it is a gift (free to play) from the Developers. I enjoyed it, some may not but it is worth taking the few moments it takes to play through it. Thank You Red Dwarf Games.

This is an interesting one.  It's more like an interactive short story than a 'game' in the traditional sense. You solve some puzzles to help a little blop advance through the story, by clicking on items that are subtlely highlighted through the rather nice scenery.  The art is very stylish, the music is very soothing, and the game is a little slower-paced. All in all, for what it is, it isn't bad, though admittedly, I think I'd need someone to explain the meaning behind it. It's a bit lost on me.  It's worth a shot, in my opinion. It's free, so the only thing you have to lose is roughly fifteen minutes of your time.  (I'd also reccomend Windowsill, Machinarium, or Samorost2 [Samorost1 is free and browser-based] if you're interested in another game similar to this one. They cost money, but are good if you're into this sort of thing.)
This is a nice, simple little game. It's cute, but also kinda creepy.  When you're bored or don't know what to play, you can just play this game and relax.  I really liked it :)
This game is worth playing if you like to contemplate about your life, moreover it's free and quite cute.

This little snack of a game is very atmospheric; you 'play' a little fruit-shaped tentacled alien maurading through what I believe is the titular Old Tree. You don't really play the alien so much as you make way for him through the tree by clicking little bits of the background that are far, far too dark to see unless you've raised the brightness on your screen to 11.   This game is an enjoyable way to while away the time waiting for a pot of water to boil. If this is the appetizer, Machinarium is the entree.

Hmm, This is a tough one.  I enjoyed similar short games like The Plan, but I felt that The Old Tree was lacking the same sort of purpose. The animations are cute and the presentation well done. When the game was over in about 12 minutes, however, I just stared at my screen and went ' . . . huh'  Overall: An imaginative and intriguing short game. Needs some work to make it feel worthwhile.
very nice game to play and it is free so give it try
Click at points puzzles. Chech the guides for a walkthrough. Try it, then delete it.
Very interesting

It's short and it's simplistic but that doesn't detract from the beauty of this game. It's a little puzzler which has you smiling the whole way through. You don't know where you're going or why but hey - you gotta get there right?

A 15 minutes journey with your new apple-shaped alien friend! There are no real puzzles since you spend most of the time random clicking in pitch black areas, but it's a fun experience. Nice art and nice ending.
is 5 minutes long dont click much dont do much  not really missing out on anything if you dont play it

The Old Tree is a charming point-and-click puzzle game, with a rather dark and mysterious twist. The more you progress in the game, the weirder the puzzles get. While the puzzles are fairly simple, they still amaze me by how creative they are and how much fun they were to solve. Even with the dark ambience, the game is some what adorable, and just makes you want to hug the little creature trying to escape the tree.   I did love this game, but I was disappointed by the fact of how short the game is. The game is only 18 minutes long (It was for me anyway), and by the art and creativness, I think this game has true potential! This game should be longer, it dosen't have to be a super long game, but atleast long enough to keep players satisfied.  I digress. Even with the short play time, I think this game was well made. I recommend this game to the fullest, and I hope this reveiw helps in your decision on wheather or not you want to install this game.
I've completed the game. I've enjoyed it. Wish it had a longer story. Give it a try guys it's free. Recommended.
A quick ambient point-and-click adventure. Super relaxing.
At the beginning I was a little confused. But after all it's a beautiful game, or story.

Cute game and nice art. Just it wasn't done all that well. Very dark, no real way to know what your supposed to do. I ended up holding down my mouse button and moving around the screen.   That said I think I will look out for the next game of this dev.
Best 10 minutes game i've ever played. No dialogues, only one character but a story with a very deep meaning.
too much water, but alien tomato baby makes up for it. I r8 8/8 m8.
this is a game to rule them all. i recomend to anyone and everyone. i just hope that their is more to come and i would easly pay to play this game.
Short, simple, nice artwork a very good game to play and relax for 20 minutes

The protagonist is boring and ugly and the gameplay is clicking to the random points of darkness with a hope that anything will happen. There is no fun or interesting story. Most regretable waste of time.

10/10 would cook again but no really I did enjoy this short little game it was fun and simple with a minor challenge. The look of the game was beautiful to me I guess I just like the general feel of it. All in all it's a good game I recommend this game.
I just watched 10 mins of my life go to waste.
Nice short game! The graphics are nice Too bad there is no story Character is weird Simple puzzles GJ!
It's a easy and funy game. I love it.

It´s really really short but it was a good calming experience. I imagine it can be a good entry for people interested in puzzle games but it´s way to easy for seasoned ones.  I loved the atmosphere.  If you´re stressed and just want to relax a little bit put on some headphones and enjoy.
I have set him free...I do wish you can see where he lands and continue.

A beautiful little game that left me smiling! I love the atmosphere and the alien and highly imaginative world. One of the strengths of these games is not knowing what comes next, and this little gem is no exception.  It's a small point'n-click Flash game (much like  Machinarium ). It's only 20Mb and takes about 15 min to finish. But you are taken on a journey and immersed in an alien world. Simple yet rich graphics and wonderful ambient sounds. The Puzzles are funny and satisfying.  It leaves you wanting more and luckily  Red Dwarf Games  [www.reddwarfgames.com]  are working on  Tales of Cosmos  that i suspect will be fantastic fun when it comes out.

It's free, an it takes about 15mins to complete. 'The Old Tree' is a very easy interactive cinematic. You watch an alien (an apple with legs, as one reviewer here called it) that automatically goes from scene to scene, or setpiece. Each setpiece presents you with a (rather easy) point & click challenge. Solve a few of those, and you get to the conclusion, which is not really a conclusion, but rather a beginning.  Make of that what you will. Personally, I found nothing in the game particularly engaging or clever. But, as a short experience, not bad.
Great short little game. Super calming and somewhat mysterious atmosphere.  Simple point and click. Good if you want to relax for a little bit.
wtf??? I dont get it the puzzles are easy and it is quite slow i have no recommendation for this game do whatever you want with it

This is a cute, free, small puzzle game that is enjoyable for each minute you play it.  I got to cook, avoid a cockroach, fly, go excorcist style on the walls, and not to mention my character which could be an apple, or an alien. That's for you to decide.

It's simple and unique, there is no menu, no loading of some sort nor forced stops such as long and boring talking, besides the rather pitch black moments (wherever the character is, it's dark, but at some points it's pitch black and you can't see anything, being able to just spamclick everywhere), the game has it's beauty and charming style.  It's puzzles aren't those near-impossible, like 'Portal 2' near-end-game, but also, aren't those that someone would be offended as if the game dev was calling their players 'dumb', it's simple with a little bit of complexity so the player has to at least think.  The game is small in both files size and campaing, it has 20mb and does not last much more than 15~25 minutes of playthrough, it's nice and calm, and worth the time.  There's not much to tell about it's story, there's most of it in the description and the game itself doesn't 'tell' much about it.  It's a good game, worth the try.
I loved the game, it was short, but beautiful. A games length doesn't matter, it's how beautiful the game is and how well it tells a story, all in all, it is a fabulous game.
Fun little simple puzzle game you can finish within 10 minutes, was really anticipating a jump-scare but it didn't happened. This is why i have trust issues...

Some people might say this game is just a pretty and sweet short game with no underlying message. They are dead wrong. My god, right from the word go I saw the metaphors leaping from the game. The beauty of this game is that even the developers play along and pretend its about nothing more than a sweet little alien! This game deflty covers everything from the concept of cloud seeding by the government to suffrage rights for women in an oppressive world. There's even hints of fear mongering and it raises really interesting questions about quantum physics and its role in your relationship with your parents. You could easily burn a good 5-6 hours on this game, probably more if you want to really dig into the issues it raises. I also found if I recorded the background music and played it backwards at half speed, I could hear the (pretty obvious) voice of Margret Thatcher telling me it was time to get in touch with my inner sexy horse whisperer. This game helped me reidentify with my true calling, and I believe it can do the same for you. 10/10

Very simple, cinematic adventure with a few creative logic puzzles thrown in. Great for kids, or adults who are tired of blowing up mechs, or decapitating soldiers, often the appeal of a creative adventure is refreshing, relaxing, with great music and ambient sounds. A great example that a good game doesn't always need to be accompanied by a Red Bull or Rockstar, but maybe a cup of tea. Very relaxing way to kill some time, and enjoy the creative artwork and sounds of this cute puzzler.
an interesting cute and mysterious little game highly reccomend its free and lasts roughly half an hour and its a small download you've got nothing to lose go play it :)
It's cute, amusing, stylish, and free. Think of it as a syle demo and have a few minutes of fun.
Short and sweet. The little alien is rather cute.
a cute free game that you need to play. not much to it but what it does it great

This game was beautiful and absolutely one of the best games I played. Though simple I felt happy at the end, I knew the creature had places to go and an everlasting adventure to experience. The art was masterfully done. I wish there was more but im satisfied with this game. I love stuff like this, it was simple but in its own way so complex leaving questions like ' where will he go?' Will he meet another? I loved this game and i WILL play it again. I eccomend this game to anyone with a bit of patience and curiosity
Very well made and a very pretty game.   Beautiful!
If you love Samorost, you can give this a try, even if it is not that good.
Creepy..But also slighty amusing.
Loved the plot twists and the art styles but it really needs to be longer
A delightful 15 minute interactive story involving an alien and its first chapter of life.
Very very dull. Not much really happens in it. Some 'puzzles' but very simple. Over all bad game
What the ♥♥♥♥

This does surely not count as game, you can barely name it an interactive short film.  There is almost nothing you can do in this 'game' beside watching this badly animated onion-thing move around almost static background screens. From time to time there it is possible to interact with just one piece of the environment and then you get to watch this thing move onto the next area to do the same.  So the Positive thing about this strange thing here is that it takes only ~12 min to go through and doesn't take up very much space on your HD. Or you can just watch a Playthrough on Youtube or whatever and get the exact same experience without wasting space.
really good game hard puzzle great soundtrack and all around good fun for the whole family

A short and relaxing point-and-click puzzle game that lets you figure out on your own how to solve each puzzle (which are quite easy and nothing wrong can ever happen) to progress through the game. The game is simple, beautiful and F2P so if you have 10 minutes to spare then give it a try!

Can't really see the point in this or if it had some or any meaning, but It wasen't bad. After playing it twice and thinking I would say that 'The world is far bigger then what you first might think. You just have to go out and find it.'??? That is me making up meaning where I don't see it. (If there even there is none to be see.)  If I was to praise it, I'd say it looked nice visually and the sound kinda gets you in it. If I had to criticize it, I would say it required no thought to progress, you can just look at the screen and click on something that looks like you can click it.  On the bright side I don't feel like it was a waste of time, but I can't say that I can recommend it. There is not really anything there to recommend about it.

If you like waiting for a mutant sperm to crawl across screen as you desperately click every pixel to try and find the button to help it continue to crawl onward with zero motivation or story or character depth whilst listening to someone having fallen asleep on a moog in the next room from the miicrophone, then this game is for you.
Fun, Short game worth playing. Would like to see this game continue development.

This was without a doubt the cutest horror game I've ever played.  In all seriousness, this is definitely worth taking the time to play. If you're actually expecting a horror game, you'll be disappointed, but other than that it's pretty decent and doesn't take very long to get through. It's really worth it just for how insanely adorable it is.
A short game but really good.

Review For The Old Tree  You may see that I've only played this game for 30 minutes... that's how long the game is. You may be thinking, wow, a half hour game, how dumb. You sir, are wrong.  Alright, so you may or may not be this alien, you are definitely following it. There is no story, no background story at least, you are just this alien that is trying to get back to space. Now, what do you do? Control the alien? Nope. You are controlling the environment around him or her, which is surprising cool.   The graphics don't need to be good, but they are, well at least the environment is, especially in the cave areas. Basically, the alien moves to a certain point and you have to try to find a way to get him/her to progress the level. It is a puzzle game, but it's a point and click puzzle game. Some of the puzzles are really simple, leading to a 3 second progression time and others had me for as long as about 10 minutes (the water one especially) and the puzzle difficulty are the right level, which is the best. It's a free-to-play game, so you can't beat that and it takes about 1 minute to install, this game is fun. No music however, but sound effects which makes the game a lot more mysterious.   You don't grow any bond on the alien but you do feel bad for him, you have that part where you're despirately wishing that he will find a way home. 30 minutes worth of gameplay is enough for this game, no story and just a ton of puzzles for maybe an hour more would be a little boring. No multiplayer neither a title screen, if there was one complaint I had about the game was that there are no options or title screen, that would have been nice to mess around with. There's no title for the game when you are playing either however, an Adobe 11 message is what fills your screen.  For a free-to-play, 30 minute, puzzle game (no spoilers) but a quick but enjoyable ending, point and click, no music but errie feel, alien loving, bee crushing, soup making, water cranking, bee-water-carrying, this game will give you nothing less than a fun and good time, is it replayability worth? Yup, I do have to say.  Who else thought the alien had a green apple as his head at the beginning? -Detroit0127
If you're bored, play this game. It is ridiculously short and leaves you wanting more.

This game... There's not much to it, it takes about 15 minutes to play through, but, I liked it a lot, the sound design art and atmosphere of it are really good, it's completely free, which is weird for a game, but it is very good, it reminds me vaguely of... I don't really know, it's cute, it's quaint, I liked it, you should play it.

A great little, free game.  Simple puzzles and easy control.   Atmospheric 'Limbo'-style platform Graphics,  Didn't look amazinlgy-fantastic on a 40' HDTV, but that's Flash for you.  Good Sound Effects and Background Audio.  Completed it without straining my brain, eyes or peripherals, and zero death count.  Not a fan of Flash used as a game engine, but I come from land, formally known as DOS.  Well done Dev! Keep up the good work and make a unique engine!
Very cute game to kill time. Took me 16 minutes. It's a tiny game.  I loved the artwork, music and short 'story line'. Very adorable. Must be tried at least once. <3
With regard to the issue of content, the disjunctive perturbation of the spatial relationships brings within the realm of discourse the essentially transitional quality.
What the hell just happened to me?
Download and finish in 20 minutes that's about it. Short and simplistic with a twist as spooky
A fun short game if you want to take a break. Because of my dumbness it did take me a while to get to the end.
The horror when I though that little alien baby would drown... But seriously, it's really nice and relaxing game. Worth playing.
Cute, interesting, and short. Not something I would play twice, but definetly worth a shot. My little onion creature will live on.
This was an enjoyable little puzzle game. A much better use of time than Assassin's Creed: Unity.

An interesting and very short(maybe 15 minutes) game. I'm not a big fan of puzzle games like this where you're basically randomly clicking on everything when you're stuck, although this game was definitely worth it. I really like what they did with the art/graphics in this game while creating a sense of atmosphere. Worth playing considering it is free and doesn't take that long to play.

Your imagination is instantly peaked when you start to play as an alien blob-like thing. The Old Tree is a short game that takes very little time to complete, however, it inspires many different feelings throughout the course of the game.  Gameplay: My playthrough took about 20 minutes, which I have noticed is about the average for most people. The moves encompassed the 'w,s,a,d' buttons (really, mostly just the 'a and d' buttons) and your mouse. For this game, those movements worked perfectly to get you from point A to point B.   Graphics: The developers have done a very good job keeping your focus on the alien-baby you are controlling, with darker undertones for the background. This accentuates the vivid coloring of your character. I thought the graphics were well done with a sort of 'drawn on' effect.  Audio: The music for this game is phenomenal! The melodies of course changed with different scenes, but did not take away from the experience in anyway. Instead, the music only enhanced the action! The songs themselves did more for the general ambience of the game then everything else (gameplay/graphics).  Storyline: This game has a very basic storyline that is really easy to follow. It seemed to me as though is was kind of a twist to the point and click genre. Your alien-baby is on rails throughout the game, and you only move ahead once you can sort out the puzzle. The puzzles are simplistic for the most part and do not take a lot of time to get through, so the overall flow of the game is not broken up.  There are so many ways to experience this game, and I think most people will have varying opinions on what it all is supposed to mean. To me, it started out symbolizing fear. Fear of the unknown, and what was to come for such a tiny creature. It then moved into more of a feeling of triumph, and the knowledge that one can do anything, as long as the will and the effort are there. With a game that takes under half an hour to complete, the playthrough is still a very pleasant occasion. Overall, I believe that this game is completely worth it, and I would highly recommend it, especially because it is offered for free.

I started thinking wat was tat red light? Then I knew the game had started. Fun game actually, if you dont mind just spending 5-10 mins of your free time to appreciate wat the devs hav done to create tis short, but very fun game. Wat they should improve is on to make it a bit longer in the storyline, but still quite fun wth the short puzzles! Would allow young kids to play! I would luv to see more of tis kind of games on Steam more often.

Well that was a fun little experience. It was cute, easy, and short with soft, unobtrusive music. Since it's free, I'd definitely recommend most everyone give it a try. If you have 20 minutes to spare, give it a go. Or you can plop the kids down in fron of it to keep 'em busy for maybe twice as long. Definitely made me smile :)
The Old Tree is free, super cute and only fifteen minutes long. The puzzles aren't very tough to beat, but they are inventive! <3
It's a storybook style game, just click and set it free! It's cute, but really simple/straightforward. Like a basic Flash 'walkthrough'.
Cute little game to play if you want to lose 15-ish minutes. Nice to play once only though, does not have really a story or particularly intriging.
Worth the time because it is just a relaxing game. If you're bored af try this game.
Wonderfully atmospheric mini game, entirely free of charge!
An odd story that leaves you more confused at the end than you were from the start.
I didn't know what creature is that until I read the synopsis. Well, I recommend this 13 minutes-game. Short, but so deep.

If you want to test your brain just enough to amuse you, check this game out. The gameplay is super short so taking several minutes out of your day for a few brain teasers isn't going to hurt. You're a cute alien thing, when in the world will you ever have the chance to be one?  Pros: Music goes along with the setting of the game Gameplay and controls are simple (point and click)  Cons: It was short (despite me recommending this game lol. I like longer lasting ones) You are slow...er than a snail

Bad pacing, bad puzzles. Good music, interesting - though not exceptional - art style. Mediocre story - if you can even call it a story. The game takes 30 minutes tops so you can try it but I can't say I have enjoyed that time.
Short. Several simple puzzles.   If you like games like this try machinarium or samorost I,II,III.
Eh, the game takes 15 minutes to complete. It's really relaxing though. Like a bedtime game. Now I want a nap.
Quite a slow game not very enjoyable
fun and simpel with a good ending
Cute but basic,
This game was too short.
Very short, more like an interactive animation than a game. But worth checking out.

A beautiful experience, I don't recommend for you thrill-seekers out there, but if you just want a pleasant 20ish-minute experience following the journey of an alien creature in a marvelous world, try this game out.

Nice little game, the devs have potential. Reminds me kind of the wood spirits from Ghiblis Princess Mononoke, like life and how it goes on with a mystic touch... Don't know, it just wakes that feelings in me. ;)
Short, but very nice and interesting.
I could have been watching paint dry...
What was that all about?
If you are looking for a wierd and creepy game to waste 15/30 min on then you came to the right place . wud r8 10/11 m8
Pretty short but fun puzzle game. I liked the art and animation.

This game will take you 5 minutes. FIVE minutes of watching this little alien-thingy hatching from an egg and guiding it to an unknwon destination. The gameplay is rather simple but for a little game like that that's totally fine. The graphics and sounds are awesome and they create a great atmosphere.  This is a small indie game to enjoy, don't expect something great  Definetly worth playing!
Very very short! But still great, funny!
Short cute story.

Nice little game. Took me 12 minutes to complete. The background music is rather soothing, the little alien dude is cute, and the ending made me happy. Good aesthetics, fairly simple puzzles. Worth the time I think.
Neat little art game, I enjoyed it.
Short but fun game.
Truly a lovely game. Definately worth your time. Short, sweet and beautiful. Also ADORABLE.
Ten minutes of your time well spent.
Great little game to play wastes about 15 minutes of your life like with other games but with some good graphic work
Loved it! A bit short, but looks great and is really good fun. Would love to see a sequel, or more fleshed out version?
The only bad thing I can say about this game was that it was too short.
A cute, easy game. It's actually more of an interactive short film, doesn't take long to play and has great graphics.
this game is literally the most adorable thing on the planet i want to die
Cute little interactive story game with great artwork. Just guide a little squid thing to its destination. Pretty visuals, nice and simple and also free.
This cute 10-15 minute puzzler is simple yet brilliant; not everyone will like the concept, but this little alien is certainly cute.

What an interesting and cute game. I actually enjoyed this game greatly even though it was really short. The protagonist was a little adorable creature and you pretty much try to climb a tree the entire game. But you know what i had a great time playing the game in general. Try this out for yourself if you really like short little story games.

it reminded me of lymbo. or the other similar flash game where oyu played as robot.very short only 6 levels, i think it was called something like machinarium ...not sure, it was very cool, awesome music. this is similar .. simple but liked it a lot ! :)
wish there was a game from these guys, a fun point and click
best short game i play in steam :D

Cute little point-and-click puzzler with fairly obvious clues in most places. No graphic violence, the only death is that of a fly you swat. Very appropriate for anyone that can reliably operate the mouse.
AWESOME GAMEPLAY :) although some are quiet tricky but overall are easy and great art there bud :D
got 10 mins to blow? play this cute lil puzzle.
